intro: Uvaria macropoda, commonly known as the large-fruited uvaria, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological contexts. Uvaria macropoda thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
